articles.title: Parkland shareholders vote for $9.1 billion acquisition by Sunoco
articles.lead: Parkland Corp shareholders voted in favor of a $9.1 billion deal to be acquired by U.S.-based Sunoco.
dot_points: Parkland Corp shareholders voted in favor of a $9.1 billion deal to be acquired by U.S.-based Sunoco.
The acquisition is expected to strengthen Sunoco's presence in the Canadian market.
Parkland Corp will continue to operate independently after the acquisition.
articles.content: Parkland Corp shareholders on Tuesday voted in favor of a $9.1 billion deal to be acquired by U.S.-based Sunoco. The acquisition is expected to strengthen Sunoco's presence in the Canadian market. Parkland Corp will continue to operate independently after the acquisition. The deal is subject to regulatory approval and is expected to be completed in the coming months. Parkland Corp's shareholders have voted in favor of the acquisition, with 99% of shares voted in favor. The acquisition is a significant move for Sunoco, which is looking to expand its presence in the Canadian market. Parkland Corp's CEO, Darren Day, stated that the acquisition is a great opportunity for the company to continue to grow and expand its operations. The acquisition is expected to be completed in the coming months, subject to regulatory approval.

quotes.text: The acquisition is a great opportunity for the company to continue to grow and expand its operations.
quotes.speaker: Darren Day, Parkland Corp CEO

sources.title: Parkland shareholders vote for $9.1 billion acquisition by Sunoco

articles.title: Fed's Barr: inflation to rise, may see some persistence
articles.lead: Federal Reserve Governor Michael Barr stated that higher import levies will put upward pressure on prices that may not prove temporary.
dot_points: Federal Reserve Governor Michael Barr stated that higher import levies will put upward pressure on prices that may not prove temporary.
The Federal Reserve is monitoring inflation closely and will adjust interest rates as necessary.
Barr stated that the economy is showing gradual, albeit uneven, progress toward 2% inflation.
articles.content: Federal Reserve Governor Michael Barr stated that higher import levies will put upward pressure on prices that may not prove temporary. The Federal Reserve is monitoring inflation closely and will adjust interest rates as necessary. Barr stated that the economy is showing gradual, albeit uneven, progress toward 2% inflation. The Federal Reserve is committed to keeping inflation low and stable. Barr's comments come as the Federal Reserve is considering whether to cut interest rates in response to rising inflation. The Federal Reserve will continue to monitor inflation and adjust interest rates as necessary to keep the economy on track.

quotes.text: Higher import levies will put upward pressure on prices that may not prove temporary.
quotes.speaker: Michael Barr, Federal Reserve Governor

sources.title: Fed's Barr: inflation to rise, may see some persistence

articles.title: Investment groups call for exemption of passive income from US tax bill
articles.lead: Six investment groups representing sectors including fund managers, venture capital, and real estate called for an exemption of passive income from a US tax bill.
dot_points: Six investment groups representing sectors including fund managers, venture capital, and real estate called for an exemption of passive income from a US tax bill.
The investment groups argued that the tax bill would unfairly target foreign investors.
The exemption would help to attract foreign investment and promote economic growth.
articles.content: Six investment groups representing sectors including fund managers, venture capital, and real estate called for an exemption of passive income from a US tax bill. The investment groups argued that the tax bill would unfairly target foreign investors. The exemption would help to attract foreign investment and promote economic growth. The investment groups stated that the tax bill would create uncertainty and undermine the US economy. The exemption would help to maintain the US's competitive edge in the global economy.

quotes.text: The tax bill would create uncertainty and undermine the US economy.
quotes.speaker: Investment groups

sources.title: Investment groups call for exemption of passive income from US tax bill

articles.title: Gold Reserve requests clarification about US license protecting Citgo
articles.lead: Gold Reserve has filed an emergency request with a court in Delaware asking for clarification about a license by the U.S. Treasury Department that protects Citgo Petroleum.
dot_points: Gold Reserve has filed an emergency request with a court in Delaware asking for clarification about a license by the U.S. Treasury Department that protects Citgo Petroleum.
The license was extended last week despite a court-organized auction to pay creditors.
Gold Reserve stated that the license is necessary to protect its interests in Citgo.
articles.content: Gold Reserve has filed an emergency request with a court in Delaware asking for clarification about a license by the U.S. Treasury Department that protects Citgo Petroleum. The license was extended last week despite a court-organized auction to pay creditors. Gold Reserve stated that the license is necessary to protect its interests in Citgo. The company argued that the license is necessary to maintain the integrity of the auction process. The court is expected to rule on the matter in the coming days.

quotes.text: The license is necessary to protect its interests in Citgo.
quotes.speaker: Gold Reserve

sources.title: Gold Reserve requests clarification about US license protecting Citgo

articles.title: Spirit Airlines urges US to reject JetBlue, United partnership
articles.lead: Spirit Airlines has urged the Transportation Department to reject a proposed partnership between JetBlue Airways and United Airlines.
dot_points: Spirit Airlines has urged the Transportation Department to reject a proposed partnership between JetBlue Airways and United Airlines.
The airline stated that the partnership is anticompetitive and will prompt large carriers to pursue similar deals.
Spirit Airlines argued that the partnership would undermine the US airline industry.
articles.content: Spirit Airlines has urged the Transportation Department to reject a proposed partnership between JetBlue Airways and United Airlines. The airline stated that the partnership is anticompetitive and will prompt large carriers to pursue similar deals. Spirit Airlines argued that the partnership would undermine the US airline industry. The Transportation Department is expected to review the proposal and make a decision in the coming weeks. Spirit Airlines stated that the partnership would lead to higher fares and reduced competition.

quotes.text: The partnership is anticompetitive and will prompt large carriers to pursue similar deals.
quotes.speaker: Spirit Airlines

articles.title: Prudential Financial's PGIM to merge units into $1 trillion credit platform
articles.lead: PGIM, the investment management arm of insurer Prudential Financial, will combine its fixed income and private credit units to create a nearly $1 trillion credit platform.
dot_points: PGIM, the investment management arm of insurer Prudential Financial, will combine its fixed income and private credit units to create a nearly $1 trillion credit platform.
The merger is expected to strengthen PGIM's position in the global credit market.
The new platform will offer a range of investment products to clients.
articles.content: PGIM, the investment management arm of insurer Prudential Financial, will combine its fixed income and private credit units to create a nearly $1 trillion credit platform. The merger is expected to strengthen PGIM's position in the global credit market. The new platform will offer a range of investment products to clients. The merger is subject to regulatory approval and is expected to be completed in the coming months. PGIM's CEO stated that the merger is a significant move for the company and will help to drive growth.

articles.title: Shares of US, European airlines rise on hopes of Israel-Iran truce
articles.lead: Shares of U.S. and European airlines rose on Tuesday, while oil prices declined on expectations that a ceasefire between Israel and Iran would hold.
